com.yworks.yfiles.layout.hierarchic

Class DefaultDrawingDistanceCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.layout.hierarchic.DefaultDrawingDistanceCalculator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDrawingDistanceCalculator

    public class DefaultDrawingDistanceCalculator
extends Object
implements IDrawingDistanceCalculator
    This class is a default IDrawingDistanceCalculator implementation that is used by HierarchicLayoutCore to configure the INodePlacer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DefaultDrawingDistanceCalculator()
      Creates a new instance of DefaultDrawingDistanceCalculator with default settings.

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public void dispose(LayoutGraph graph,
                    ILayers layers,
                    ILayoutDataProvider ldp)
        Description copied from interface: IDrawingDistanceCalculator
        Disposes of internal data structures.

        Implementations should release internally held data structures when they are not needed any more.

        Specified by:
        dispose in interface IDrawingDistanceCalculator
        Parameters:
        graph - the input graph that contains all elements that are used during the node placement
        layers - the ILayers object that will be used during subsequent calls
        ldp - the ILayoutDataProvider implementation which provides access to the INodeData and IEdgeData instances
        See Also:
        IDrawingDistanceCalculator.initialize(LayoutGraph, ILayers, ILayoutDataProvider)

      • getEdgeToEdgeDistance

        public double getEdgeToEdgeDistance()
        Gets the minimum distance between two edges.

        Minimum distance should be greater than 0.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the minimum distance is negative
        Default Value:
        The default value is 20.0d.
        Returns:
        the given minimum distance
        See Also:
        setEdgeToEdgeDistance(double)

      • getMinDistance

        public double getMinDistance(LayoutGraph graph,
                             ILayer layer,
                             ILayoutDataProvider ldp,
                             Node left,
                             Node right)
        Determines the minimum distance between two Nodes of the same layer.
        Specified by:
        getMinDistance in interface IDrawingDistanceCalculator
        Parameters:
        graph - the input graph
        layer - the ILayer object that will be used during subsequent calls
        ldp - the ILayoutDataProvider used for querying information
        left - the left of the two Nodes whose minimum distance is to be determined or null if only the left border of the right Node is of interest
        right - the right of the two Nodes whose minimum distance is to be determined or null if only the right border of the left Node is of interest
        Returns:
        the minimum distances between Nodes of same layer

      • getNodeToEdgeDistance

        public double getNodeToEdgeDistance()
        Gets the minimum distance between a Node and an (non-adjacent) Edge.

        Minimum distance should be greater than 0.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the minimum distance is negative
        Default Value:
        The default value is 15.0d.
        Returns:
        the minimum distance
        See Also:
        setNodeToEdgeDistance(double)

        Gets the minimum distance between two Nodes.

        Minimum distance should be greater than 0.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the minimum distance is negative
        Default Value:
        The default value is 30.0d.
        Returns:
        the minimum distance
        See Also:
        setNodeToNodeDistance(double)

      • isAdaptiveMinimumEdgeDistanceEnabled

        public boolean isAdaptiveMinimumEdgeDistanceEnabled()
        Gets whether or not an adaptive minimum edge distance is used.

        If this option is enabled the minimum distance between two adjacent edges is the minimum of the current minimum edge distance and the distance of the edges' source/target points.

        Default Value:
        The default value is true. An adaptive minimum distance is used.
        Returns:
        true if an adaptive minimum distance should be used, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setAdaptiveMinimumEdgeDistanceEnabled(boolean)

      • isCompactionEnabled

        public boolean isCompactionEnabled()
        Gets whether or not the compaction option is enabled.
         
        This option is automatically set by the layout algorithm if option NodeCompaction or LabelCompactionEnabled is enabled.
        Default Value:
        The default value is false. Compaction is disabled.
        Returns:
        true if compaction is enabled, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setCompactionEnabled(boolean)

      • isSwimlaneDistanceOptimizationEnabled

        public boolean isSwimlaneDistanceOptimizationEnabled()
        Gets whether or not to use an optimized minimum distance calculation for swimlane layouts.

        If set to true this instance will report 0.0d as the minimum distance between two nodes if they belong to different swimlanes. This avoids unwanted feedback between different swimlanes during node placement.

        Default Value:
        The default value is false.
        Returns:
        true if modified distance calculation for swimlane layouts should be used, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setSwimlaneDistanceOptimizationEnabled(boolean)

      • setAdaptiveMinimumEdgeDistanceEnabled

        public void setAdaptiveMinimumEdgeDistanceEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets whether or not an adaptive minimum edge distance is used.

        If this option is enabled the minimum distance between two adjacent edges is the minimum of the current minimum edge distance and the distance of the edges' source/target points.

        Default Value:
        The default value is true. An adaptive minimum distance is used.
        Parameters:
        value - true if an adaptive minimum distance should be used, false otherwise
        See Also:
        isAdaptiveMinimumEdgeDistanceEnabled()

        public void setCompactionEnabled(boolean value)

      • setSwimlaneDistanceOptimizationEnabled

        public void setSwimlaneDistanceOptimizationEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets whether or not to use an optimized minimum distance calculation for swimlane layouts.

        If set to true this instance will report 0.0d as the minimum distance between two nodes if they belong to different swimlanes. This avoids unwanted feedback between different swimlanes during node placement.

        Default Value:
        The default value is false.
        Parameters:
        value - true if modified distance calculation for swimlane layouts should be used, false otherwise
        See Also:
        isSwimlaneDistanceOptimizationEnabled()
